column4: I have an issue with K9Copy and libdvdread.  Whenever I try to copy a dvd with its original menus using K9Copy (without original menus isn't affected), I get a fatal error.  Anybody know anything about this?  Error message from console is available.  System is Debian Sarge/Etch.
why don't you pastebin your errors and bring us the URL ?
put it in #flood?
a pastebin would be better, it'll float away in #flood
ok can you give me a pastebin link?
pastebinned in paste.ubuntu-nl.org under name peteweez
did it have a URL ?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/21936
you can add that URL to your question for best results
ok
Did the errors make any sense to you?
i'm looking, gimme a minute please
!headers
unfortunately, i can make nothing of your errors.  keep asking every 5 minutes or so  :(
!tell Dravas about headers
OK thanks for your time anyway :).
Obviously it's something to do with libdvdread but I don't know what...I've heard about newer versions of libdvdread having issues with my software, and I have the newer version
perhaps you can downgrade it ?
Yeah I installed older libs but I don't know how to force the prog to use the old libs and not the new libs.  Do I need to recompile my prog?
remove the newer libs ?
Removing new libs breaks many other packages...not an option.
i suspect you need a more knowledgable person
keep asking about every 5 minutes
